page.title: 01A GENERAL REVIEW OF TREVERVA
page.content: The area provides a rural setting for pastoral farming with a scattering of working and disused granite quarries. The roads are generally narrow and winding which hinder communications and contribute to the remoteness of the area. The main settlement within the block is a hamlet called Treverva which has a church and a post-office. {The block is named after this hamlet. The area has a link with tourism in the form of a caravan and camp site and bed and breakfast establishments. The highest point within the block is 193 metres above sea level and the area is interspersed with small streams.
